ygData.subject: Re: [neat] New Book Finally In Print: Why Greatness Cannot Be Planned

A huge congratulations to Ken and Joel for this book coming out!


Best reg=
ards,
Jeff Clune

Assistant Professor, Computer Science
Director, Evolving =
Artificial Intelligence Lab <http://evolvingai.org/>
University of Wyoming
=
jeffclune@...
jeffclune.com

> On May 11, 2015, at 11:05 PM, kstanley@=
cs.utexas.edu [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> Joel Lehman and I a=
re pleased to announce the publication of our new book by Springer:
> 
> Wh=
y Greatness Cannot Be Planned: The Myth of the Objective
> 
> You can get i=
t at Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/d=
p/3319155237 <http://www.amazon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/=
dp/3319155237>
>   
> 
> Or through Springer: http://www.springer.com/us/bo=
ok/9783319155234 <http://www.springer.com/us/book/9783319155234>
> 
> As so=
me of you know, Joel and I have long thought that the implications of novel=
ty search and non-objective thinking in general extend far beyond only mach=
ine learning and evolutionary computation.  From the way we as a society en=
courage innovation to the interpretation of evolution in nature, the implic=
ations of the objective paradox touch an enormous breadth of domains, inclu=
ding of course the now-familiar algorithmic insights.  Our new book finally=
 gives us the chance to weave all these disparate threads together into a s=
ingle unified perspective.  As a rare example of algorithmic insights from =
AI leading to a broader social and cultural critique, we hope you will find=
 its message inspiring and thought-provoking.   Of course we're always happ=
y to hear your thoughts as well. 
> 
> Here's the cover:
>  
> 
> 
> 
> Bes=
t,
> 
> 
> 
> Ken and Joel
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_00B1A7D6-1466-4CCD-9C31-E69423A667AC

>
<span style=3D"display:none" class=3D""> </span>



    <div id=3D"y=
grp-text" class=3D""><p class=3D"">Joel Lehman and I are pleased to announc=
e the publication of our new book by Springer:<br class=3D""><br class=3D""=
><span style=3D"font-weight:bold;" class=3D"">Why Greatness Cannot Be Plann=
ed: The Myth of the Objective</span><br class=3D""><br class=3D"">You can g=
et it at Amazon: <a rel=3D"nofollow" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"http://www.a=
mazon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237" class=3D"">=
http://www.amazon.com/Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237<=
/a></p><p class=3D"">  <br class=3D""></p>Or through Springer: <a rel=
=3D"nofollow" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"http://www.springer.com/us/book/978=
3319155234" class=3D"">http://www.springer.com/us/book/9783319155234</a><br=
 class=3D""><br class=3D"">As some of you know, Joel and I have long though=
t that the implications of novelty search and non-objective thinking in gen=
eral extend far beyond only machine learning and evolutionary computation.&=
nbsp; From the way we as a society encourage innovation to the interpretati=
on of evolution in nature, the implications of the objective paradox touch =
an enormous breadth of domains, including of course the now-familiar algori=
thmic insights.  Our new book finally gives us the chance to weave all=
 these disparate threads together into a single unified perspective.  =
As a rare example of algorithmic insights from AI leading to a broader soci=
al and cultural critique, we hope you will find its message inspiring and t=
hought-provoking.   Of course we're always happy to hear your thoughts=
 as well. <br class=3D""><br class=3D"">Here's the cover:<br class=3D""><di=
v class=3D"">  <br class=3D"webkit-block-placeholder"></div><img src=
=3D"http://www.cs.ucf.edu/%7Ekstanley/cover_hires_50pcnt.png" width=3D"150"=
 class=3D""><br class=3D""><br class=3D""><br class=3D""><p class=3D""><spa=
n class=3D"">Best,</span></p><p class=3D""><br class=3D""><span class=3D"">=
</span></p><p class=3D""><span class=3D"">Ken and Joel<br class=3D"yui-curs=
or"></span></p><div class=3D""><br class=3D"webkit-block-placeholder"></div=
>

    </div>
